course_title: Topics In Jewish Literature: Holocaust Literature
class_notes:
(Same as JS 375W 1)
(As the destination for half a million Holocaust survivors, Israel is a center of formation of Holocaust literature. Indeed, Modern Hebrew literature devoted great attention to the subject, and the Holocaust is the main or secondary theme of numerous works, testimonial-fiction, stories and novels, poetry, and drama. The course is a survey of some of the main (translated into English) literary productions authored by survivors - Ida Fink, Abba Kovner, Dan Pagis, Yechiel Dinnur), and one author far distant from the scene of crime (Lea Goldberg.)
course_description: Seminar on special issues in Jewish writing. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
